observation: Harbour Investments - Independent Midwest Broker Dealer | Madison, WI  Home Prospective Advisor Why Harbour? Testimonials Video Testimonials Products & Services Commissions & Payouts Business Resource Tools Join Us Clients Regulation BI Your Financial Professional How We Work Disclosures Definitions Helpful Links About Our History Charitable Initiatives News Harbour In the News Events and Highlights Harbour News Archive Contact Advisor Login Technology that is progressive and above the competition Learn More A hybrid firm with no platform fees "We were met with open arms and welcomed by all." - Scott B. Midwestern Values Learn About Us Previous Next Harbour Investments founded in 1987, in the beautiful city of Madison, Wisconsin Harbour could not be where we today without our advisors. We treat our advisors the way they treat their clients, with respect and dignity. We currently serve approximately 220 investment advisors located in 14 states. I am an Advisor I am a Client Why Choose Harbour? we believe in: Partnership We are a partner dedicated to advisors throughout their business lifecycle.  To do this we have to know our advisors well and strive to see them four times per year. Independence This is the advisor’s business.  Their culture and values should guide the journey, not the broker-dealer or RIA. Value We have fair payouts and keep expenses low.  No platform fees in our RIA helps keep client expenses lower. Learn More about Us ... November 21, 2023 See More Updates "Transitioning to Harbour Investments was as easy as humanly possible." The day of my resignation, I had a family emergency and had to leave town.  With the help of their transition team, I was still up and running faster than if I had done it myself.  After it was complete, I had only wished I would have done it 10 years ago.  Weekly commissions and literally being called my first name are only a few reasons why I consider myself at home. Neal Rohrs , Charlotte, MI; Joined Harbour in January, 2013 Read More Testimonials "I'm very happy to say that not only have they done everything they promised, they've done more." I've been in the business for 13 years and am only 36 years old and it's very comforting to know that this will be the last career move I make.  I feel like I've found a home with Harbour. Aaron Cade , Viroqua, WI; Joined Harbour in August, 2011 “Harbour is the best BD I've worked with large or small.” With 32 years in financial services, I've had at least eight Broker Dealers.  Harbour is the best BD I've worked with large or small.  Because of the help and guidance they've provided, they deserve some credit for the success I've had since joining them in 2001.  Even with the market tumult, these have been my highest earning years. Rita Wilczek , St Louis Park, MN; Joined Harbour in October, 2001 Locate A Representative contact us today to connect to your local representative! 575 D'Onofrio Drive Madison, WI 53719 (608) 662-6100 (888) 855-6960 info@harbourinv.com Follow Us on LinkedIn Careers Webmail Log In FINRA FINRA's BrokerCheck SIPC |

However, I should verify the legitimacy of the information provided and the business itself.

thought: The WHOIS information indicates that the domain harbourinv.com is registered and has been in existence since 1996, which is a good sign as scam websites are often relatively new. The use of a privacy service for registration details is not uncommon, but it can sometimes be a red flag. However, given the long-standing presence of the domain, it is less concerning in this context. To further validate the website, I should check for customer reviews or reports about the website from external sources.

thought: The search results provide some positive signals, such as an active Facebook page and a review on a scam detector website that gives the domain a medium-high trust score, suggesting it might be a legitimate business. Furthermore, testimonials on the website and details about fees on a financial advisory site lend credibility. To solidify these findings, it would be wise to check for any negative reports or scam accusations on social media and discussion platforms.

There are no results found on Reddit related to harbourinv.com, indicating that there isn't any significant discussion or reports of the website being involved in scams on this platform. Given that we have not found any scam indicators and have some evidence suggesting legitimacy, such as the long-standing presence of the domain and positive reviews, we are leaning towards the website being legitimate. However, to fully confirm the legitimacy, one final step would be to check the affiliations mentioned on the website, such as with FINRA and SIPC, to ensure they are accurate. This can provide a final piece of evidence to confirm the website's authenticity.

The SIPC (which stands for Securities Investor Protection Corporation) fills a similar role as the FDIC does, only it operates in the securities industry.It was established under the Securities Investor Protection Act (SIPA) of 1970 and mandates membership of most U.S. registered broker dealers.'}, {'url': 'https://thegdfg.com/whoweare/', 'content': "These marks are awarded to individuals who successfully complete the CFP Board's initial and ongoing certification requirements. thought: The search results confirm that Harbour Investments is indeed listed with FINRA and SIPC, as the website claims. There is a specific mention of Harbour being a member of SIPC on their own disclosures page, and an external source verifies Harbour Investments Inc. as a registered broker-dealer with FINRA. These affiliations are significant indicators of a legitimate financial firm, as both organizations are key in regulating and protecting investors in the United States. Based on the WHOIS record showing a long-standing domain, the absence of scam characteristics from the website's content, the positive reviews found through search results, the active social media presence, and the confirmed memberships with regulatory bodies (FINRA and SIPC), I can now make an informed judgment on the legitimacy of harbourinv.com. I now know the final answer. harbourinv.com does not appear to be a scam website.

observation.reason: The domain has been active since 1996 WHOIS information shows a legitimate registration the website's content is consistent with a genuine investment firm there are positive reviews and no significant scam reports found and the website is confirmed to be affiliated with regulatory bodies FINRA and SIPC.
